meanings.definition: A person or thing that imitates or mimics someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: My little sister is always one of the copycats in her class, trying to dress like her friends.
meanings.sent2: The group of copycats at the office always follow the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent3: The copycats in the movie were so funny, trying to copy the main character's dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The copycats in the jungle imitated the calls of the other animals perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The copycats in the play made the audience laugh with their hilarious imitations.

meanings.definition: To imitate or mimic someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: Kids often copycats their favorite cartoon characters when playing pretend.
meanings.sent2: She copycats her older sister's style by wearing similar clothes.
meanings.sent3: The parrot copycats the sounds it hears around the house, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The artist copycats nature in their paintings, capturing its beauty.
meanings.sent5: He copycats his mentor's teaching style to engage his students in class.
